data.title: Cannot reach actions with keyboard
data.body:
Testing #23287

In the new keybindings experience.

Cannot reach the edit/remove/add actions on a row with the keyboard. I have tried arrow left/right or tab, but I could not make focus reach those actions.

I think the prompt is a bit dramatic, perhaps no prompt, since to run it I need to right click and click again (i.e. unlikely I ran the action by accident)

data.title: Word wrap not working for some file types

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (d4a9c30378579fc4980d5bc272c7eb65a7c576ab, 2017-03-28T07:25:45.304Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-database|bajdzis|1.2.0|
|vscode-icontheme-nomo-dark|be5invis|1.2.6|
|unique-lines|bibhasdn|1.0.0|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|vscode-stylesheet-formatter|dbalage|0.2.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.8|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.46|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.11|
|Theme-TwoStones|gerane|0.0.2|
|vscode-postcss-sorting|mrmlnc|2.3.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.0|
|js-atom-grammar|ms-vscode|0.1.12|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.11.0|
|PostCSS|ricard|1.0.1|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.6.1|
|vscode-autohotkey|slevesque|0.1.1|
|vscode-material-syntax-dark|woodywoodsta|0.1.1|;


---

Word wrap doesn't seem to work for some types, including .sql, .json and .cs, while it works for other types, including .md.

`"editor.wordWrap"` is set to `"on"`.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new file without an extension
2. Start typing text long enough that it should wrap
3. Note that the text doesn't wrap, and selecting `Toggle Word Wrap` has no effect
4. Save the file with an .md extension
5. Note that the text wraps correctly, and `Toggle Word Wrap` has the desired effect

Gif:
![wordwrap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/594564/24399628/a4b42ab4-13ad-11e7-9589-36767155c5de.gif)

data.title: Adopt Search input widget in Settings and Keyboard shortcuts editor to use commands for keybinding dispatching

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
while testing #23243:

- VSCode Version: Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open any file in editor
2. increase or decrease the view size (I'm using cmd-up arrow and cmd-down-arrow)

Observe: editor size changes

3. open Keybindings editor
4. increase or decrease the view size (I'm using cmd-up arrow and cmd-down-arrow)

Observe: item selection changes

I'm not sure whether this is the desired behaviour. If I'm setting the keybinding for the "Increase/decrease View Size" commands, I would expect that they apply everywhere.

data.title: Exception widget text wrapping not perfect
data.body:
Refs #23013

1. Start debugging some program with an exception
2. Exception widget opens -> decrease the size of the screen bit by bit so you get word wrapping
3. Notice how the wrapping is not perfect -> in my screenshot you can see that there is an empty line which should not be the case, it should contain the text which is not visible on the previous line

![screen shot 2017-03-28 at 11 51 29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/24399437/0eae8406-13ad-11e7-997c-0136bef6c63c.png)

data.title: VScode undo updated save code after update and save new file
data.body:
Dear Developers. I'm Having issue with VSCODE. Previously it was working fine. But from now a days  It gave Headache. When I open VS CODE saved one line of code. It saved but when I goto new file and update new code and saved and back to previous updated code. I saw its outdated or didn't Updated. I having this issue since 2 weeks. I don't know What is the issue why is doing like this.

My System Configuration:
OS: Linux 64bit Ubuntu
VSCODE: 
Version 1.10.2
Commit       8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331
Date 2017-03-08T14:00:46.854Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

data.title: decorations in keybindings.json do not react to kb layout change
data.body:
Open keybindings.json and add the following content:
```
{
        "key": "ctrl+'",
        "command": "editor.action.commentLine",
        "when": "editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly"
    },
    {
        "key": "ctrl+/",
        "command": "-editor.action.commentLine",
        "when": "editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly"
    }
```
Switch to GER-ch keyboard layout. 

Those keypresses should be highlighted **immediately**. Now you must do an edit in a file before they are highlighted:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/24399214/534f42e0-13ac-11e7-93f0-72a6967f1fef.png)

data.title: Stopping debug session does not close exception widget
data.body:
Refs: #23013

1. Have the following program and start debugging
```javascript
throw new Error('hello');
```
2. Notice how the exception widget is nicely shown - now stop debugging, exception widget is still shown. I would expect it to automatically hide

Upon further inspection exception widget does not get closed when I am doing any step event.
It should automatically also close in that case

data.title: Improve keybindings search in Keyboard shortcuts Editor
data.body:
Testing #23287

- searching for ctrl+k should be the same as searching for control+k
- same for cmd on OSX
- Highlight rendered keybindings those got matched (symbols or text) instead of appending text (ARIA Label) for matches

data.title: Reset keybinding not available for "removed"
data.body:
Testing #23287
Right click on a default keybinding
Choose remove
Confirm
The reset keybindings is not available

It is possible the current model where defaults are removed make this difficult to implement properly. Perhaps we need a different call in the service to get the defaults and this action can be based on the actual defaults rather than the "resolved" defaults.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/24398733/d376f05a-13aa-11e7-9b2c-7fa523d24b2f.png)

data.title: Terminal should reprompt if workspace shell setting changes.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- Tests: #23128 
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-Insider
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Configure `	"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\WINDOWS\\Sysnative\\bash.exe"`
2. Press allow when prompted
3. Change the setting to a harmful executable (can come in via a git pull)
4. Create a shell. Observer the new value is trusted and taken. We should reprompt.

data.title: Pressing Cmd in keystroke box always fills in some previous key combination
data.body:
testing #23243:

- VSCode Version: Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

Before I ran into this bug I had assigned a key combination "cmd+shift+1" for the "Increase Current View Size" command (and did some testing with this).

1. open Keyboard Shortcuts
2. Pick some entry and click the edit button ('pen')
3. press 'Cmd' key

Observe: some previously used (or defined?) key combination is entered as the first part of a chord. In the following screen cast I'm only pressing the "command" key:

![2017-03-28_11-28-09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/24398542/1dd6dd6e-13aa-11e7-9be1-5fd2067663fe.gif)

data.title: Edit button is permanently shown
data.body:
Testing #23287

I clicked edit a couple of times, and now I am in a state where the text is white on whites and the edit button is shown. I also switched keyboard layouts.

I think somehow the list thinks the selection is on that row:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/24398598/558cc188-13aa-11e7-8e62-7f25e3942c62.png)

This funny state recovers once I click on a different row.

data.title: Define keybindings widget is not cleared in between different keybindings
data.body:
Testing #23287

* Define a keybinding using the widget
* Accept
* Open the widget again
* On a press, the previous accepted value shows up as the first part and the new input is considered a chord part.

This is caused by the chord code.

fyi @sandy081

data.title: Can't allow a before disallowed integrated terminal
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
- Tests: #23128 
- VSCode Version: 1.11.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. customize a shell workspace settings using `"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\WINDOWS\\Sysnative\\bash.exe"`
2. Disallow the shell

Try to allow the shell. The only way I found is to use the dev tools and delete the key.

data.title: 'Restart Task' command for multiple running tasks fails
data.body:
Ref: #23279

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: Win10
- Tasks Version: 2.0.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run two tasks in parallel 
2. Fire 'Tasks: Restart Task' command. Nothing appears in quick open menu.

**Expected**: quick open with selection for which task to restart.

![restart multiple tasks](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2239563/24397939/071120d2-13a8-11e7-8284-67a2eddca901.gif)

**tasks.json:**
```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "showOutput": "always",
    "tasks": [
                {
            "taskName": "tsc 1",
            "command": "tsc",
            "args": [
                "-w"
            ],
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "isBackground": true,
            "problemMatcher": "$tsc-watch"
        },
        {
            "taskName": "tsc 2",
            "command": "tsc",
            "args": [
                "-w"
            ],
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "isBackground": true,
            "problemMatcher": "$tsc-watch"
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: Relaunch terminal after shell selection on Windows
data.body:
Testing #23130

(Might be caused by #23357)

* Choose Customize from the info message
* Choose cmd
* The user settings are automatically changed to contain: `"terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\windows\\Sysnative\\cmd.exe"`

* Observe, the integrated terminal still shows Powershell:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/24397628/2c5eed84-13a7-11e7-8747-8fe78605c8f6.png)

**Edit:** After restarting VS Code the integrated terminal now uses cmd.exe

data.title: Keybinding customization - only shows the keybindings of activated extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The `vscode-tslint` extension is contributing key bindings. However, these keybindings are only available for customization in the editor, once the extension is activated and the user has opened a TypeScript file.

The user should be able to customize keybindings independent from whether an extension is activated or not.

data.title: 'Restart Task' command does not restart the task
data.body:
Ref: #23279

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create tasks.json with the structure below.
2. Run 'tsc 1' task.
3. Run `Tasks: Restart Task`.
4. The task is terminated but no restart happening, UI shows the following error:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2239563/24397209/d5ac9cda-13a5-11e7-9619-c2123fc46160.png)

**tasks.json:**
```
{
    "version": "2.0.0",
    "showOutput": "always",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "tsc 1",
            "command": "tsc",
            "args": [
                "-w"
            ],
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "isBackground": true,
            "problemMatcher": "$tsc-watch"
        }
    ]
}
```
Neither in tasks v0.1.0, nor 2.0.0 works.

data.title: Word navigation does not reveal cursor
Order of buttons in terminal info message is not Windows standard
data.body:
Testing #23130

Usually, on Windows all message boxes have the Cancel button as the most right hand-side option e.g. [OK, Cancel] etc.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/24397175/c11aaa3c-13a5-11e7-91fc-f3f428e8dbbc.png)

data.title: 'Terminate/Restart Task' command should be user-friendly when no task is running

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Ref: #23279

When 'Restart Task' command is clicked and no task is running, there is no notification that the task is not running.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run 'Restart Task' or 'Terminate Task' command when no task running.
2. Observe no UI response.

Similar behaviour when running 'Debug' category commands produces the following notifications:
> Command 'Debug: Restart' is not enabled in the current context.
> Command 'Debug: Stop' is not enabled in the current context.
